title: Bernardo's Birth
narration: During the Spanish occupation, a kind, hardworking, and God-fearing couple lived in San Mateo, Rizal. For a long time they had no children.

title: A Miracle Child
narration: But Bathala heard their prayers and Bernardo Carpio was born, possessing extraordinary strength and vigor. A Spanish priest named him after a famed warrior in Spain.

title: Young Strength
narration: From childhood, Bernardo showed remarkable strengthâ€”able to pull up nails.

title: Mighty Feats
narration: He could even pull up entire trees.

title: Rescue of Hagibis
narration: He once saved a horse that had fallen off a cliff. He named the horse Hagibis, who became his loyal companion.

title: Rising Oppression
narration: As he grew, Spanish oppression intensified. Filipinos began to gather to fight for their freedom, and Bernardo, for his strength and courage,

title: Chosen Leader
narration: was chosen as a leader of the uprising. The Spaniards feared him and plotted an ambush.

title: The Enchanted Plot
narration: They conspired with an enchantress who they held, offering to stop the exorcism in exchange for using her talisman against Bernardo.

title: Deceptive Meeting
narration: They invited Bernardo to a false meeting, but as he passed through a cave,

title: Stone Trap
narration: The enchantress activated her talisman and the rocks slammed together, trapping him.

title: Trapped
narration: Bernardo could not escape and was pinned by the stones. He struggled with his strength, but it matched the power of the enchantress' talisman.

title: Hagibis Waits
narration: Meanwhile, Hagibis waited, and when Bernardo did not return, the horse sought help from the people.

title: Discovery and Loss
narration: In the end the men found the cave, but they were met by falling rocks and could not rescue Bernardo.
